RULES (taken from Fro99er who took them from GuyInFreezer and modified for this game)

General Rules:


  1. Site-wide rules always apply here.
  2. If you have a question for me, you can always PM me. If you need to talk to me in thread, please bold your question like this so I can see it
  3. You may not use hidden or encrypted text. I decide if the text is small enough to be count as hidden text.
  4. If you have a power to edit/delete your post, don't do it. If you scumslip, just accept it and eat rope.*
  5. Play nice. Insulting players with using any form of racial/sexual slur or any kind of derogatory languages or excessive harassing in any way will result in immediate force-replacement.*
  6. There will be strict adherence to the site policy about prohibiting discussion of ongoing games, which can be found here*
  7. This means do not discuss other ongoing games in this thread AND do not discuss this game elsewhere.
  8. Do not quote the PM that moderator sends you. Paraphrasing is fine until a certain level. If you're not sure about it, you're always welcome to ask me first before you post.*
  9. Do not use provable randomization in this game. Saying that you rolled a dice is fine, using dice tag is not.
  10. This is my color (#000080). Don't use it or colors closely resembling it.
  11. If I find the certain factors/actions damaging the state of the game, I will intervene and/or take action.
  12. Keep the personal complaint, whatever they may be, outside of the wrong VC/information, private by PMing me.
  13. If you break these rules, I have full rights to punish you at my will. This can range from simple warning to modkill/force-replace.
  14. I will always consult a list-mod before performing any modkill.
  15. VIOLATING THE RULES WITH A STAR (*) WILL CAUSE AN IMMEDIATE FORCE-REPLACE NO MATTER THE CIRCUMSTANCES!
  16. If I feel like it, I always have a full right to add/modify the rules. If I do, I will fully explain the reason behind such action.
  17. Flavor has absolutely zero bearing on the game. It is just for fun.
  18. Most importantly, have fun!

Voting and Lynching:

  1. You vote by either using bold tag([b]Vote: iDanyboy[/b]) or using vote tag ([vote]iDanyboy[/vote]) as such Vote: iDanyboy or VOTE: iDanyboy
  2. Unvote is not required to change your vote. Also, if it looks like a vote for someone, I will count it. No tricking me!
  3. A player is lynched when the majority of living players -- half players alive plus one rounded down -- vote for the same player
  4. Once the player is lynched, the lynchee and the living players may talk until I get back and post the flip.
  5. If the deadline is reached before the lynch has reached, the day will end with No Lynch.
  6. If you're killed, you may not post a "bah" post.

Activity and Deadline:

  1. Deadline for each day phase is: 14 days.
  2. Deadline for each night phase is: 2 days.
  3. If you're on V/LA, please tell me beforehand by either posting it in thread (bolded) or PM to me. Any V/LA that lasts longer than 120 hours (=5 RL days) will be a force replace.
  4. If you don't post here for 48 real hours, I will prod you. Failure to receive prod within 24 hours will cause force-replacement.
  5. Three prods overall will equate to a force replace.
  6. If you do not submit an action before the night ends, it will count as No Action.
  7. There will be deadline extensions given in this game only upon the moderators discretion.

Game Information:

  • This game features a single scum faction.
  • Daychat is disabled by default.
  • Scum may use any abilities they have along with their factional abilities on the same night.
  • Game will begin when 12/13 have confirmed their roles.

Sample Role PM
    Welcome to Mini Normal 1938, Player name

    You are a Vanilla Townie.

    Abilities:
    • You possess no special abilities other than your vote and your voice.
    Win condition:
    You are aligned with the Town and win when all threats to the Town have been eliminated and at least one Town-aligned player is alive.

Player by Player:

The good
Backhand - cooperative, open and looks like they're genuinely trying to figure out the game. Their tone feels town and also their questions and interactions seem to logically come from a town perspective. I like this guy.
Lovelife - interacts a lot, isn't afraid to share opinions or to put themselves out there for scrutiny. Appears to be thinking about other player perspectives and trying to sort them. Their tone sometimes feels a bit off or blunted to me sometimes, and a capable scum player could pull off their game. Doesn't mean they are scum though, just something I'm keeping in mind.
Sofiel - Not really enough activity for my liking so far, however she has had some good interactions. The questions are pertinent and her tone feels quite town. More activity of this kind would solidify them in my mind as a town player to work with.
Tchill13 - This is the flimsiest of my town reads because their activity is a bit low as well, but their posts seem to be trying to steer people towards working together. There's been a little bit of unproductive conversation that Tchill has seemed to try to get us off. This isn't a huge or very strong town play, but it's slightly indicative of alignment I believe. Enough that I feel better about them than some of the other players so far.

Could go either way
Robbvna - I've so far found them to be stand-offish, yet they say they want to cooperate. I find their overall tone off-putting and they seem to jumble their words and ideas around, but I can't really say it's a deliberate or definitely scummy thing. They're on vacation now and they professed to dislike the early game, and based on what others have said about them I'm willing to allow space for that and let them be for now. However if their input into the game doesn't show improvement then I think they're likely to be mafia.
Hopkirk - They feel quite out of place so far and cagey about their activity levels, as if they're aware that their low input relative to others makes them look bad. But they're asking questions and appear to be trying to solve the game. Their tone feels off but they do seem to be trying to solve the game with their small amount of content so far.
Havo - This is someone that concerns me because despite their high activity, I can't quite place their motives or intent. They seem quite ready to agree with me and are voting Cloud with me. Although I don't really like the way they painted Cloud's reads as something inherently 'fake' and also impede the way others play. 'Too early for bull in the china shop' seems like a strange statement to make. They often make commentary on other people's play, without making the effort to actually understand it first. The tone feels almost combative in some cases, and even though I agree with their conclusions on some things I wonder about their 'process' for getting there.
IgnitionUSMC - Their most recent post is a really big red flag to me. This one:

In post 394, IgnitionUSMC wrote:Im pulling my vote back off because at this point we need to either just wagon someone. I've also been extremely busy at work and Im just not used to this fast of a game pace from where I came from.

If you want me to list my scum reads... honestly im not sure at this point. But i agree with Tchill on id rather save my lynch for lynching mafia, then policy lynches followed by a night kill by mafia. At least give town a chance to lynch mafia


The highlighted parts are the bits I dislike.

1. Removing your vote because you think we just need to wagon someone - isn't removing your vote the exact opposite of trying to achieve this goal?
2. You think we should just wagon someone, but you're not sure who. Alright, I could accept this as making sense if not for the next point #3
3. Wanting to make sure we lynch mafia.

If you want to really try and lynch mafia, but you're not at all sure who might be mafia - how can you be okay with just wagoning someone? Wouldn't you want to try figure out where to direct the wagon first? I'm very interested in IgnitionUSMC's responses to this.


The bad
BBT - please interact and play the game. I think that it's much more likely that scum plays like this early game, where it's hardest to come up with reasons for things and scum can often be caught.
Fykus - seems to be poking at people in ways that don't appear town to me. In many cases it's like they're prodding at a person specifically, rather than trying to figure out their intent or motive. They're very lacklustre in their hunting so far.
Jordarrian - This would be where my second vote would go. Introduces themselves, gets put under pressure and responds to that. Once the pressure is gone, they disappear from the game and apparently are no longer interested. This is not how I've seen town play.
Cloudkicker - Honestly has just been ridiculous so far. Claims to dislike RVS, but their attitude towards the game has not changed a single bit since leaving RVS. Makes a post and then references their own post as being a town-like post that mafia wouldn't do, and their reasons for why they are not mafia are not backed up at all. They claimed mafia would not have 6 "townleans" this early, because it would be too hard to explain that many townleans. But that's exactly what they've just done; they haven't explained them. When questioned on one of them they simply said something to the effect of it being "lowest on the list" and haven't explained or given reasons for any of them so far. Saying scummy things and then pretending you were joking isn't solving the game and I think they're very likely mafia trying to play the "too scum to be scum" card. The only other explanation is that they're just playing awful as town out of spite, but I'd also expect them to be more adamant and emotive if that were the case. When town do that, it's usually easier to read. This just seems like a poor attempt at it. At best they're a very lazy, disengaged and unproductive town member - which is more likely to be scum than people trying to play the game.
